alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Coastal Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 05 at 10:25PM EST until November 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM EST SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding expected over the next few high tide cycles. This flood potential is separate from future flooding associated with developing low pressure in the Atlantic. More significant coastal flooding will be possible Tuesday and beyond depending on the evolution of the low. * WHERE...Coastal Palm Beach, Coastal Broward and Coastal Miami- Dade Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Wednesday evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from this morning through at least Monday evening. * IMPACTS...For the Coastal Flood Statement, some water on low lying roads and property. Additionally, rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Coastal Palm Beach County
